info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 6:13PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pima and southeastern Pinal Counties through 700 PM MST... At 612 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Saddlebrooke, or near Catalina, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oro Valley and Oracle Junction. This includes the following highways... Route 77 between mile markers 89 and 94. Route 79 between mile markers 92 and 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
